page.title: 09Glenalmond:Life styles
page.content: A farmer's wife said that their farm is only affected by the College because of the fruit shop open to the boys and the school facilities open to them. Life does not differ much in the holidays apart from that it is quieter and it is generally the busy time of year, so she helps out on the farm. Her life would not differ if she lived further away, but it would were she to live in a town. The College Manciple, and his wife who is a cleaner, donate all their time to the College. Theirs is a 24 hour job, as the wife stands in for the Manciple sometimes, so life does not change much in the holidays. Then, they are nearly always in the College, tending to security and making daily checks. They feel very lucky to have a job, although their retirement is drawing near. They wish to stay in Perthshire.
